intro: Sphaeralcea fumariensis, commonly known as the smokebush or desert globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its spherical, woolly seed pods that give it its common name, and it produces showy yellow flowers in late spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. Sphaeralcea fumariensis is adapted to withstand drought and heat, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
